intro: Pouteria atabapoensis, commonly known as the Atabapo chestnut, is a species of flowering plant in the Sapotaceae family. It is native to the Amazon rainforest, particularly in regions of Colombia and Venezuela. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall and produces large, elongated fruits that contain edible seeds. The leaves are alternate, simple, and typically have a glossy surface. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role within its native habitat.
